block.p: Leslie Frances Anatol, the daughter of Theodora Affong of New York and Selwyn Anatol of Leesburg, Va., was married yesterday to Anthony Adlai Deckoff, a son of Jane and Marvin Deckoff of New York. The Rev. Brent Hart, a nondenominational minister, performed the ceremony at the Footprints Eco Resort in Culloden, on the island of Tobago.
The couple met while working at 20th Century Fox in Los Angeles, the bride as a features development assistant and the bridegroom as a script development analyst.

Leslie Frances Anatol, the daughter of Theodora Affong of New York and Selwyn Anatol of Leesburg, Va., was married yesterday to Anthony Adlai Deckoff, a son of Jane and Marvin Deckoff of New York. The Rev. Brent Hart, a nondenominational minister, performed the ceremony at the Footprints Eco Resort in Culloden, on the island of Tobago.
The couple met while working at 20th Century Fox in Los Angeles, the bride as a features development assistant and the bridegroom as a script development analyst.
Mrs. Deckoff, 32, is now a student at Santa Monica College. Her father is the senior financial officer at ADJ Enterprises, a promotional advertising company in Leesburg.

Mr. Deckoff, 33, is now a script development analyst at Universal Pictures in Los Angeles. He graduated from Yale University and received a master's degree in transportation planning from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. His mother manages classical music performers and composers in New York. His father, who is retired, owned the Tribune Printing Company, which was in New York.
